subject: JVM argument "java.ext.dirs"
msgSnippet: JUnit v3.8.1 does not appear to use the JVM argument java.ext.dirs . If it does, please help. -I am using ant to execute JUnit tests. My ant target references
messageBody:
JUnit v3.8.1 does not appear to use the JVM argument "java.ext.dirs".
If it does, please help.

-I am using ant to execute JUnit tests. My ant target references
external jars using the JVM argument "java.ext.dirs". My test fails
trying to load a class that is in the external JAR directory. The
JUnit Swing UI hangs, displaying "Load Test Case...". The error
written to standard out is NoClassDefFoundError.

-When I call the Swing TestRunner main with the "-noloading" argument,
the test still fails. This time the UI finishes and displays a "Class
not found" message. Nothing is written to standard out.

-I tried not using ant and passing the "java.ext.dirs" arg in using my
IDE. Same problem.

-When I pass the external JAR reference in with the classpath
argument, the test succeeds.

My ant target is below.

<target name="runUnitTest">
<java fork="true" classname="${unitTestClassName}"
classpathref="run.classpath">
<jvmarg line="${jargs}"/>
<jvmarg value="-Djava.ext.dirs=${externalJarDir}"/>
</java>
</target>
